rules.rationale: SHHS = Sleep Heart Health Study, PSG = Polysomnography. Two tables (SHHS1_PSG, SHHS2_PSG) with ~1300 vars each from overnight sleep recordings.
ECG recordings from SHHS sleep study visits. SHHS1_ecg and SHHS2_ecg, ~34 vars each.
Catches remaining SHHS table (CHS_SHHS1_15K) â€” sleep quality questionnaire with 65 vars.

Matched by description containing 'Medical History'. CHS uses opaque table names (YR5NEW, BASE1, YR12PH, YR12ANNUAL) but descriptions consistently say 'Medical History'. Covers baseline through year 17, 50-1421 vars per visit.
rules.description: e.g. 'CARe_CHS_YR5NEW - Medical History', 'CARe_CHS_BASELINE - Medical History (1)', 'CARe_CHS_YR12ANNUAL - Medical History'

rules.rationale: Matched by description containing 'Ultrasound'. Three carotid ultrasound datasets at baseline, year 5, and year 11.
rules.description: 'CARe_CHS_Ultrasound data - Baseline', 'CARe_CHS_Ultrasound data - Year 5', 'CARe_CHS_Ultrasound data - Year 11'

rules.rationale: Matched by description containing 'MRI'. Two brain MRI result tables with 125-133 vars.
rules.description: 'CARe_CHS_MRI1_Details of MRI results (I)', 'CARe_CHS_MRI1_Details of MRI results (II)'

rules.rationale: Table names explicitly say BONE_DENSITY. Baseline/Year 7 and follow-up datasets.
Event summary and time-to-event datasets for adjudicated cardiovascular outcomes.
ICD-9 diagnosis code table from hospitalization records.
Matched by description. Mineral metabolism panel including vitamin D, calcium, alkaline phosphatase, phosphate, and parathyroid hormone.
Individual biomarker assay tables identified by name: adiponectin, D-dimer, cystatin C (renal), IMT (Polack method), coronary artery calcium, and venous thromboembolism. 3-5 vars each.
Supplemental biomarker panel not covered by visit-specific labs.
Administrative/linkage tables: date of birth category, DNA draw year, children's birth years, and CHS-to-NSRR (National Sleep Research Resource) ID mapping.
rules.description: e.g. 'CARe_CHS_DOB_CAT', 'CARe_CHS_DNA_DRAW_YEAR', 'Subject ID mapping - CHS to NSRR'
